summary: User requests ability to inject a custom reader into WorkerFactory to support gradual migration from legacy annotation-based workflow/activity registration to Temporal attributes. Current implementation uses final classes, preventing subclassing and customization.
userImpact: Users migrating from legacy systems cannot gradually transition to Temporal attributes without reimplementing the entire WorkerFactory.
rootCause: WorkerFactory and related classes are declared as final, preventing subclassing and customization of the reader selection logic.
proposedFix: Add ReaderInterface as an optional parameter to WorkerFactory::create() method, similar to how DataConverterInterface is already handled. Make createReader() method protected or allow dependency injection via constructor.
workaround: Copy the entire WorkerFactory implementation to customize the reader selection logic.
resolutionDetails: The issue was closed after the user agreed to submit a PR addressing the feature request.
keyQuote: The best option of course would be if I could override the default reader with my own through constructor, just like it's done with DataConverter currently.
